parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. The client generates the value, which must be unique among different requests. The token can contain a maximum of 64 ASCII characters.

parameters.name: Lang
parameters.description:
The language of the response. Valid values:

- zh: Chinese.

- en: English.

Default value: en

parameters.name: Line
parameters.description: The DNS resolution line. The default value is default.

parameters.name: Priority
parameters.description:
The priority of the MX record. You can set different priorities for mail servers. Valid values: 1 to 99. A smaller value indicates a higher priority.

> This parameter is required if the record type is MX.

parameters.name: RecordId
parameters.description: The ID of the DNS record. To obtain the ID, call the DescribeZoneRecords operation to query a list of DNS records.

parameters.name: Rr
parameters.description:
The host record. This is the prefix of a domain name. Common examples include www, @, \* (for wildcard DNS), and mail (for mailboxes).

For example, to resolve @.example.com, set the host record to "@", not an empty string.

parameters.name: Ttl
parameters.description: The time to live (TTL) in seconds (s). Valid values: 5, 30, 60, 3600 (1 hour), 43200 (12 hours), and 86400 (1 day).

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description:
The type of the DNS record. The following types are supported:

- **A**: Maps a domain name to an IPv4 address in dotted decimal notation.

- **AAAA**: Maps a domain name to an IPv6 address.

- **CNAME**: Maps a domain name to another domain name.

- **TXT**: A text record. The text can be up to 255 characters in length. TXT records are often used for Sender Policy Framework (SPF) records to prevent spam.

- **MX**: Maps a domain name to the domain name of a mail server.

- **PTR**: Maps an IP address to a domain name.

- **SRV**: A service record that specifies the server for a specific service. The format is: Priority Weight Port Target. Each part must be separated by a space.

> Before adding a PTR record, configure a reverse lookup zone. For more information, see [Reverse DNS lookup and PTR records](~~2592976~~)

parameters.name: UserClientIp
parameters.description: The IP address of the client.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The record value. Enter a value that corresponds to the record type.

parameters.name: Weight
parameters.description: The weight of the record. Valid values are integers from 1 to 100. The default value is 1. You can set different weights for records to return IP addresses in proportion to their weights.
